title: BTC donation option in Get Involved section

requirements.summary: Display a BTC donation address under the landing page “Get Involved” → “Donate” option with copy-to-clipboard and a safe fallback when not configured.
acceptanceCriteria: On the landing page, the “Get Involved” section’s “Donate” option reveals BTC donation details (at minimum: a clearly labeled BTC address) in a way that is visible and readable on both mobile and desktop.
The BTC address is presented as copyable text (e.g., with a “Copy address” control) and provides user feedback after copying (e.g., “Copied”).
If a BTC address value is not yet configured in code, the UI does not display an invalid address; it shows a clear fallback message indicating the BTC address is not available yet.

file_operations.description: Add a small frontend configuration module for donation-related values (including an optional BTC address), allowing the UI to cleanly detect “not configured yet” and render a fallback message.

Create a reusable BTC donation details component that renders: a clearly labeled BTC address (or fallback message), a copy-to-clipboard control with post-copy feedback state, and responsive layout for mobile/desktop.

Update the “Donate” card to reveal BTC donation details on user interaction (e.g., accessible expander/inline panel), wiring in BtcDonationDetails and ensuring the content is readable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.summary: Provide an optional client-generated QR code for the configured BTC address and ensure the donation UI interactions are accessible by keyboard and screen readers.
acceptanceCriteria: When a BTC address is configured, the donation UI includes a scannable QR code representation of the BTC address (client-generated; no backend dependency).
All interactive elements in the donation UI are keyboard accessible and have appropriate accessible names/labels (e.g., for the copy control and any open/close controls if a modal/expander is used).
No backend canister changes are required to display the BTC donation information.

file_operations.description: Implement a lightweight client-side QR generation helper for the BTC address (no backend dependency), returning a renderable representation (e.g., SVG path data or canvas draw routine) suitable for use in React.

Enhance the BTC donation details UI to optionally render a scannable QR code when an address is configured, and ensure all controls (copy, show/hide QR, expand/collapse) have keyboard support and accessible names/labels.

Ensure the updated Donate interaction pattern (expander/modal/inline panel) supports full keyboard navigation (open/close via keyboard, focus order), and provides accessible labeling for the donation controls.
